chapter.title: Before You Install OpenICF Software
chapter.para: This chapter covers prerequisites for installing and running OpenICF software. If you have a special request to support a component or combination not listed here, contact ForgeRock at info@forgerock.com.

section.title: Java Requirements
section.para: OpenICF ${docTargetVersion} has been tested primarily with Java SE JRE 1.6 and 1.7, on Linux and Windows platforms.

section.title: Connector Server Requirements
section.para: If your deployment requires an OpenICF connector server, then read this section.

section.title: .NET Connector Servers

listitem.para: Windows Server 2008 R2, or Windows Server 2012 R2

section.para: Specific .NET connectors might have additional requirements, for example, the PowerShell connector requires the PowerShell V2 environment.

section.title: Java Connector Servers
section.para: Java Connector Servers require Java SE JRE version 1.6, or 1.7.
Specific Java connectors might have additional requirements.

section.title: Supported Connectors to Data Resources
section.para: This section covers the data resources that have been tested with OpenICF connectors.

Many advanced connectors not listed in this section are also available, including connectors for IBM Resource Access Control Facility (RACF), IBM Tivoli Access Manager (TAM), SAP, a wide range of databases, as well as enterprise and cloud applications. If you require support for a data resource connector not mentioned here, contact ForgeRock at info@forgerock.com.

itemizedlist.para: ForgeRock has tested, and supports, the following connectors:

listitem.para: LDAP (tested with OpenDJ, MS Active Directory, and MS ADLS)
Microsoft Active Directory (tested with the .NET connector server on Windows Server 2008 R2 and Windows Server 2012 R2)
